IRS990.MissionDesc: CANTERBURY IS A COLLEGE PREPARATORY, COEDUCATIONAL BOARDING AND DAY SCHOOL GUIDED BY LAY ROMAN CATHOLICS, FOR STUDENTS IN GRADES 9-12.
IRS990.Desc: INSTRUCTION OF APPROXIMATELY 320 STUDENTS IN GRADES 9-12, INCLUDING STUDENT SERVICES RELATED TO EDUCATION PROGRAMS, LODGING AND MEALS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE PURPOSE OF THE ENDOWMENT FUND IS TO SUPPORT THE CURRENT AND FUTURE OPERATIONS OF THE SCHOOL THROUGH THE DISBURSEMENT TO THE SCHOOL'S OPERATING FUND OF A PORTION OF THE ENDOWMENT'S INTEREST, DIVIDENDS, AND REALIZED AND UNREALIZED CAPITAL GAINS. THE LEVEL OF THOSE DISBURSEMENTS, KNOWN AS THE "SPENDING RATE", FROM THE ENDOWMENT TO THE OPERATING FUND IS DETERMINED BY THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES. ALL ENDOWMENT RETURNS IN EXCESS OF THOSE DISBURSED TO THE OPERATING FUND ARE REINVESTED.
FINANCIAL AID -4,895,557. OTHER ADJUSTMENT - LOSS ON BOND REFINANCING -705,080.
COST OF GOODS SOLD NETTED WITH REVENUE ON 990 -172,558.
COST OF GOODS SOLD NETTED WITH REVENUE ON 990 172,558.
CANTERBURY SCHOOL ADVERTISES IN BOTH INTERNAL AND EXTERNAL PUBLICATIONS ITS POLICY OF NONDISCRIMINATION ON THE BASIS OF RACE, RELIGION, NATIONAL ORIGIN, GENDER OR SEXUAL ORIENTATION.
FINANCIAL AID IS PROVIDED THROUGH A REDUCTION OF THE TUITION CHARGES.
THE HEAD OF SCHOOL IS REQUIRED TO LIVE ON CAMPUS AS A CONDITION OF EMPLOYMENT.

IssuerName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: CT HEALTH AND EDUCATIONAL FACILITIES AUTHORITY

TaxExemptBondsIssuesGrp.PurposeDesc: REFINANCING OF SERIES B BOND ISSUE

IssuerName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: CT HEALTH AND EDUCATIONAL FACILITIES AUTHORITY

TaxExemptBondsIssuesGrp.PurposeDesc: REFINANCING OF SERIES A BOND ISSUE

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: OTHER ISSUANCE COSTS - ISSUER ADMINISTRATIVE FEE, ROUNDING AMOUNT, RESERVE FUND

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 8B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: AGENDAS ARE KEPT AS A RECORD OF THE COMMITTEES' ACTIVITIES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THERE IS A SUBSET OF THE AUDIT COMMITTEE INCLUDING THE CHAIR OF THE AUDIT COMMITTEE AND THE VICE PRESIDENT OF THE BOARD THAT REVIEWS AND APPROVES THE FORM 990. THE FORM 990 IS THEN PROVIDED TO ALL VOTING MEMBERS OF THE BOARD BEFORE FILING WITH THE IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: QUESTIONNAIRES ARE CIRCULATED TO THE TRUSTEES AND KEY EMPLOYEES ANNUALLY AND MAINTAINED BY THE HEAD'S ASSISTANT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BUSINESS MANAGER PREPARES COMPARABLE HEAD (CEO) COMPENSATION SCHEDULES WORKING FROM NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF INDEPENDENT SCHOOLS DATA AND PUBLIC 990'S. THIS DATA IS FORWARDED TO THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES COMPENSATION COMMITTEE WHICH REVIEWS IT AND ADJUSTS THE HEAD'S COMPENSATION PACKAGE ANNUALLY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: DOCUMENTS ARE MADE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.
OTHER ADJUSTMENT - LOSS ON BOND REFINANCING -705,080.
